title:
Software-defined lock-in demodulator for low-frequency resistance noise
  measurements
abstract:
The resolution of low-frequency resistance noise measurements is increased by
amplitude modulation, shifting the spectrum of the resistance fluctuations away
from the 1/f noise contributed by measurement instruments. However, commercial
lock-in amplifiers used for de-modulating the fluctuations exhibit a
problematic 1/f noise contribution, which imposes a hard lower limit on the
relative resistance noise that can be detected. We replace the lock-in
amplifier hardware by equivalent digital signal processing performed using
open-source software and inexpensive data acquisition systems. Our solution
offers superior low-frequency noise performance with a reduction of the voltage
power spectral density by about two orders of magnitude compared to high-end
commercial instruments.
